Type.Name: PropertyItem
Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the <link location="node:gtk-sharp/programming/threads">Gtk# Thread Programming</link> for details.

remarks.para: The data consists of: an identifier, the length (in bytes) of the property, the property type, and a pointer to the property value.

A is not intended to be used as a stand-alone object. A object is intended to be used by classes that are derived from . A object is used to retrieve and to change the metadata of existing image files, not to create the metadata. Therefore, the class does not have a defined Public constructor, and you cannot create an instance of a object.
To work around the absence of a Public constructor, use an existing object instead of creating a new instance of the class. For more information, see .

summary.para: Encapsulates a metadata property to be included in an image file. Not inheritable.

Docs.value: To be added: an object of type 'int'

remarks.para: The following table shows the property tags and their IDs. For more information about property tags, see Image Property Tag Constants. For a description of each property tag, see Property Item Descriptions.

summary.para: Gets or sets the ID of the property.

Docs.value: To be added: an object of type 'int'

summary.para: Gets or sets the length (in bytes) of the property.

Docs.value: To be added: an object of type 'short'

remarks.para: The following table shows integers and the types they represent.

description.para: Specifies that is an array of bytes.

Specifies that is a null-terminated ASCII string. If you set the type data member to ASCII type, you should set the property to the length of the string including the null terminator. For example, the string "Hello" would have a length of 6.
Specifies that is an array of unsigned short (16-bit) integers.
Specifies that is an array of unsigned long (32-bit) integers.
Specifies that data member is an array of pairs of unsigned long integers. Each pair represents a fraction; the first integer is the numerator and the second integer is the denominator.
Specifies that is an array of bytes that can hold values of any data type.
Specifies that is an array of signed long (32-bit) integers.
Specifies that is an array of pairs of signed long integers. Each pair represents a fraction; the first integer is the numerator and the second integer is the denominator.

remarks.para: For more information about property tags, see "Image Property Tag Constants" in the MSDN library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.

summary.para: Gets or sets an integer that defines the type of data contained in the property.

Docs.value: To be added: an object of type 'byte []'

remarks.para: The byte array returned by the property contains data in one of several different primitive types. To use the data, determine the data type using the property and convert the byte array accordingly.

summary.para: Gets or sets the value of the property item.
